content.title: Leriche Syndrome
content.definition: Chronic aortoiliac occlusive disease characterized by the triad of claudication, absent femoral pulses, and erectile dysfunction, resulting from atherosclerotic occlusion of the distal aorta and iliac arteries.

concepts.definition: The three hallmark features of Leriche syndrome.

clinical_features.claudication: Buttock and thigh claudication (hip, buttock, thigh)
clinical_features.impotence: Erectile dysfunction from reduced hypogastric flow
clinical_features.absent_pulses: Absent or diminished femoral pulses bilaterally

clinical_features.atherosclerosis: Progressive atherosclerotic plaque in infrarenal aorta
clinical_features.collaterals: Lumbar, mesenteric, hypogastric collaterals may develop

clinical_features.type_a: Short stenosis or occlusion of CIA, unilateral
clinical_features.type_b: Short stenosis of infrarenal aorta, bilateral CIA disease
clinical_features.type_d: Infrarenal aortic occlusion, diffuse disease (Leriche syndrome)

clinical_features.aortobifemoral_bypass: Gold standard open surgery for TASC C/D
clinical_features.endovascular: Feasible for TASC A/B, challenging for complete occlusion

clinical_features.prognosis: Limb loss rate low with treatment, quality of life improvement

sources.reference: Defined Defined Leriche R. Bull Acad Med. 1940;123:90
